School Closed until March 30
This afternoon (3/13) the Governor announced that he will be closing all Pennsylvania Schools in an effort to curb the spread of COVID-19. Additionally, all spring sports and any school related activities are cancelled. Our staff has planned for two weeks of instructional assignments. All available materials were sent home at dismissal with students who were present today. Printed copies of all instructional materials for all grades are available for pick up at CCSA on Monday, March 16 between 9:00am - 3:00pm. Assignment information will also be emailed to families. Staff will be in touch with your child periodically during this time away from school in the event that he/she has questions or needs assistance. We will continue to communicate and provide updates as the situation evolves. Thank you for your understanding and flexibility. Stay/get healthy!

CCSA High School students learned about opportunities at the Career, Trades & Labor Apprenticeship Fair on Saturday, October 26. The event was hosted by State Senator Tim Kearney, Delaware County AFL-CIO Council and Delaware County Intermediate Unit. The Bates Award was established in 1980 by the Delaware County Planning Commission to recognize projects which employ innovative techniques and practices in accordance with modern and evolving principles of site planning, design, and development.
Those in attendance were Donald Delson, trustee and previous CCSA Board President, Barbara Klock, CCSA Board President, and Reb Speare, TCF Board Chair. We couldn't be prouder!

November 15, 2016 at 3:55 PM ·

Last Thursday, CCSA students heard from Charlayne Hunter-Gault, an African American civil rights hero and children's author. A huge thank you to The Links (www.linksinc.org), which supported this opportunity. With fitting words in what was a difficult election week for our community, Ms. Hunter-Gault talked about the arts as a civil rights tool. She reiterated the importance of children discovering and sharing their voices, taking risks, celebrating their history, and letting their true selves shine. She left our children with the uplifting words: "Dreams propel ambition: your dreams are going to propel you to be the best you can be. Your role now is to be the best you can be because the future is truly yours."
